dialogueTree.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Again?! I can't believe this shit...."
dialogueTree.english: "Again?! I can't believe this shit..." He shakes his head, looking like he really is having trouble believing this *shit*.
dialogueTree.polish: „Znowu?! We łbie się to gówno nie mieści...” – kręci głową i wygląda, jakby rzeczywiście miał kłopoty z uwierzeniem w to *gówno*.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Зноў?! У галаве гэтае лайно не ўкладваецца..." — круціць галавой і выглядае, быццам сапраўды мае праблемы з тым, каб паверыць у гэта *лайно*.

links.title: You: ""Look, I just have to ask: are we f..."
links.english: "Look, I just have to ask: are we from the same police station?"
links.polish: „Słuchaj, muszę zapytać: czy my jesteśmy z tego samego komisariatu?”
links.belarusian: "Слухай, мушу спытацца: ці мы з таго самага аддзялення?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""I'm going to say... *no*. Just to..."
links.english: "I'm going to say... *no*. Just to see what you'll say to that. What do you say?"
links.polish: „Powiem... *nie*. Tylko po to, żeby przekonać się, co na to odpowiesz. Więc co na to odpowiesz?”
links.belarusian: "Скажу... *не*. Толькі для таго, каб даведацца, што ты на гэта адкажаш. Дык што ты на гэта адкажаш?"

links.title: You: ""Okay.""
links.english: "Okay."
links.polish: „Okej”.
links.belarusian: "Окей".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Okay?!""
links.english: "Okay?!"
links.polish: „Okej?!”
links.belarusian: "Добра?!"

links.title: Horse-Faced Woman: ""Jean, he said okay, give it a rest.""
links.english: "Jean, he said okay, give it a rest."
links.polish: „Jean, powiedział okej – daj spokój”.
links.belarusian: "Жан, сказаў добра – адстань".

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Okay. I was clearly wrong. He is a..."
links.english: Okay. I was clearly wrong. He is a firefighter, male nurse, animal control agent -- something of that kind. Not a cop. Go on with your cop work. Don't let me stop you again.
links.polish: No dobra, to ewidentnie mój błąd. Jest strażakiem, pielęgniarzem, łapaczem psów – kimś w tym rodzaju. Nie gliną. Wracaj do swojej policyjnej roboty. Nie będę ci przeszkadzać.
links.belarusian: Ну добра, гэта відавочна мая памылка. Ён пажарнік, медсястра, лоўца сабак - нехта з гэтага роду. Не паліцэйскі. Вяртайся да сваёй паліцэйскай працы. Я не буду табе замінаць.

links.title: You: ""Yeah. Probably not. I don't rememb..."
links.english: "Yeah. Probably not. I don't remember you from anywhere."
links.polish: „Taaa. Pewnie nie. Znikąd cię nie pamiętam”.
links.belarusian: "Тааа. Напэўна, не. Нідзе цябе не памятаю".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""God fucking shit..." He pinches th..."
links.english: "God fucking shit..." He pinches the root of his nose.
links.polish: „Boże ja pierdolę...” – odpowiada, ściskając palcami nasadę nosa.
links.belarusian: "Божа, я хрэноў..." — адказвае, сціскаючы пальцамі аснову носа.

links.title: Empathy: "None of this is great news for him."
links.english: None of this is great news for him.
links.polish: Nic z tego nie brzmi dla niego jak dobre wieści.
links.belarusian: Нішто з гэтага не гучыць для яго як добрыя навіны.

links.title: You: ""Let's talk more about that hypothe..."
links.english: "Let's talk more about that hypothetical Station 41 you mentioned."
links.polish: „Porozmawiajmy więcej o tym hipotetycznym 41. komisariacie, o którym wspomniałeś”.
links.belarusian: "Пагаворым больш пра гэты гіпатэтычны 41-ы пастарунак, пра які ты згадаў".

Alternate1.polish: „Porozmawiajmy jeszcze o tej hipotetycznej Czterdziestce Jedynce”.
Alternate1.belarusian: «Пагаворым яшчэ пра гэтую гіпатэтычную Сарака Першую».

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Oh, the Hypothetical Four-One. Yea..."
links.english: "Oh, the Hypothetical Four-One. Yeah, let's *fantasize* about that." He blinks aggressively. "I'm not busy, you're not busy, let's just play around!"
links.polish: „Och, Hipotetyczna Czterdziestka Jedynka. Taa... *Pofantazjujmy* o tym” – odpowiada, agresywnie mrugając. „Ja nie jestem zajęty, ty nie jesteś zajęty – zabawmy się!”
links.belarusian: "Ох, Гіпатэтычная Сорак Першая. Так... *Пафантазіруем* пра гэта", — адказвае ён, агрэсіўна міргаючы. "Я не заняты, ты не заняты — павесялімся!"

Alternate1.english: "Okay," the man says with a sigh. He's waiting for you to speak.
Alternate1.polish: „Okej” – odpowiada z westchnięciem mężczyzna. Czeka, aż zaczniesz mówić.
Alternate1.belarusian: «Окей», — адказвае мужчына з уздыхам. Ён чакае, пакуль ты пачнеш гаварыць.

links.title: You: ""So what would our relationship be..."
links.english: "So what would our relationship be in this alternate universe?"
links.polish: „Jakie byłyby relacje między nami w tym alternatywnym uniwersum?”
links.belarusian: "Якія былі б адносіны паміж намі ў гэтым альтэрнатыўным сусвеце?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Let's be crazy... let's say you an..."
links.english: "Let's be crazy... let's say you and I are partners. How's that for a thought experiment?"
links.polish: „Zaszalejmy... Powiedzmy, że ty i ja jesteśmy partnerami. Co powiesz na taki myślowy eksperyment?”
links.belarusian: "Давайце адарвемся... Скажам, што ты і я партнёры. Што ты скажаш на такі мысленны эксперымент?"

links.title: You: ""Like partners in crime, or...?""
links.english: "Like partners in crime, or...?"
links.polish: „Przestępczymi partnerami czy...?”
links.belarusian: "Злачыннымі партнёрамі ці...?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""No!" he exclaims excitedly. "'Caus..."
links.english: "No!" he exclaims excitedly. "'Cause in this thought experiment we are police officers. In a police station. We don't do crimes -- we're not crime bros."
links.polish: „Nie!” – wykrzykuje podekscytowany. „W tym eksperymencie myślowym jesteśmy funkcjonariuszami policji. Na komisariacie policji. Nie popełniamy przestępstw – nie jesteśmy kumplami od zbrodni”.
links.belarusian: "Не!" – выкрыквае ў захапленні. "У гэтым мысленчым эксперыменце мы з'яўляемся супрацоўнікамі паліцыі. На паліцэйскім участку. Мы не здзяйсняем злачынстваў – мы не сябры па злачынстве".

links.title: Horse-Faced Woman: ""C'mon, stop it," she says quietly."
links.english: "C'mon, stop it," she says quietly.
links.polish: „Hej, przestań” – mówi cicho.
links.belarusian: "Гэй, спыніся", – ціха кажа.

links.title: You: ""You seem like a cool guy, I'd love..."
links.english: "You seem like a cool guy, I'd love to have you as my partner."
links.polish: „Wydajesz się być w porządku gościem. Świetnie by było mieć w tobie partnera”.
links.belarusian: "Ты здаешся нармальным хлопцам. Было б цудоўна мець у табе партнёра".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Would you now?! Or would I be *cra..."
links.english: "Would you now?! Or would I be *cramping your style?*" The man bites his lip, then waves his hand. "Never mind... *partner*."
links.polish: „Poważnie?! Nie *burzyłbym ci stylu*?” – pyta, zagryzając wargę, a po chwili macha ręką. „Nieważne... *partnerze*”.
links.belarusian: "Сур'ёзна?! Я не *парушыў бы твой стыль*?" — пытаецца, прыкусваючы губу, а праз імгненне махае рукой. "Не важна... *партнёр*".

links.title: You: ""Okay, actually you probably would..."
links.english: "Okay, actually you probably would cramp my style."
links.polish: „No dobra, właściwie to pewnie burzyłbyś mi styl”.
links.belarusian: "Ну добра, увогуле, ты б, напэўна, парушыў мой стыль".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Oh god, I'd hate for that to happe..."
links.english: "Oh god, I'd hate for that to happen... you know what might help prevent that though?"
links.polish: „O nie, nie chciałbym, aby do tego doszło... Wiesz, w jaki sposób mógłbyś temu zapobiec?”
links.belarusian: "О не, не хацеў бы, каб да гэтага дайшло... Ведаеш, якім чынам мог бы ты гэтаму перашкодзіць?"

links.title: You: ""No.""
links.english: "No."
links.polish: „Nie”.
links.belarusian: "Не".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""You doing your *fucking job*.""
links.english: "You doing your *fucking job*."
links.polish: „Wykonując swoje *pieprzone obowiązki*”.
links.belarusian: "Выконваючы свае *чортавыя абавязкі*".

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.english: "Yes."
links.polish: „Tak”.
links.belarusian: "Так".

links.title: You: ""Me doing my fucking job and not pe..."
links.english: "Me doing my fucking job and not pestering you anymore?"
links.polish: „Wykonując swoje pieprzone obowiązki i nie zawracając ci więcej głowy?”
links.belarusian: "Выконваючы свае праклятыя абавязкі і больш не турбуючы цябе?"

links.title: You: ""No, you wouldn't cramp my style at..."
links.english: "No, you wouldn't cramp my style at all."
links.polish: „Nie, nie burzyłbyś mi go ani trochę”.
links.belarusian: "Не, не руйнаваў бы мне яго ані трохі".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Okay... how about you stop wasting..."
links.english: "Okay... how about you stop wasting my time and get on with whatever you were doing then?"
links.polish: „Okej... W takim razie może przestań już marnować mój czas i wracaj do tego, czym się teraz zajmujesz?”
links.belarusian: "Добра... Тады, можа, перастань ужо марнаваць мой час і вяртайся да таго, чым зараз займаешся?"

links.title: You: ""Actually I shouldn't have called y..."
links.english: "Actually I shouldn't have called you  my partner. Kim's my partner, he's going to know."
links.polish: „W sumie to nie powinienem był nazywać cię moim partnerem. Kim nim jest i się dowie”.
links.belarusian: "У цэлым, я не павінен быў называць цябе маім партнёрам. Хто ім ёсць, і даведаецца".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm not your partner." He says qui..."
links.english: "I'm not your partner." He says quickly. "This... this union is temporary."
links.polish: „Nie jestem twoim partnerem” – wtrąca szybko. „Ta... współpraca jest tymczasowa”.
links.belarusian: "Я не твой партнёр", — хутка ўмяшаўся ён. "Гэта... супрацоўніцтва часовае".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""A little premonition for you, lieu..."
links.english: "A little premonition for you, lieutenant. Sooner or later -- probably sooner -- your new friend tells you he doesn't need you. He will then suggest you should *fuck off*."
links.polish: „Pozwól, że przepowiem ci przyszłość, poruczniku. Prędzej czy później – ale raczej prędzej – twój nowy przyjaciel powie ci, że cię nie potrzebuje. A później zasugeruje, żebyś »spierdalał«”.
links.belarusian: "Дазволь, што я прадкажу табе будучыню, лейтэнант. Хутчэй ці пазней – але хутчэй хутчэй – твой новы сябар скажа табе, што ты яму не патрэбен. А пазней прапануе табе "сыходзіць"".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""When that happens I suggest you ta..."
links.english: "When that happens I suggest you take his advice," he adds bitterly.
links.polish: „Gdy do tego dojdzie, proponuję, abyś go posłuchał” – dodaje gorzko.
links.belarusian: "Калі гэта здарыцца, я прапаную табе яго паслухаць", — дадае ён з горыччу.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant merely bows his head..."
links.english: The lieutenant merely bows his head in response.
links.polish: W odpowiedzi porucznik tylko kiwa głową.
links.belarusian: У адказ лейтэнант толькі кіўнуў галавой.

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Perfect, great, I don't give a shi..."
links.english: "Perfect, great, I don't give a shit!" He shakes his head. "Now leave us alone and do your thing... and I don't mean get drunk and piss yourself, right? You realize that, don't you?"
links.polish: „Świetnie, idealnie – mam na to wyjebane!” – kręci głową. „A teraz zostaw nas w spokoju i zajmij się swoimi obowiązkami... I nie mam na myśli chlania i obszczywania się, jasne? Chyba zdajesz sobie z tego sprawę, co?”
links.belarusian: "Выдатна, ідэальна – мне на гэта напляваць!" – ківае галавой. "А цяпер пакінь нас у спакоі і займайся сваімі абавязкамі... І я не маю на ўвазе пітво і ладзіць гармідар, зразумела? Спадзяюся, ты гэта разумееш, так?"

links.title: You: ""You seem like a bit of a drag. No..."
links.english: "You seem like a bit of a drag. No offence, but I could do better."
links.polish: „Wydajesz się trochę nudziarzem. Bez urazy, ale zasługuję na kogoś lepszego”.
links.belarusian: "Ты выглядаеш як трохі нудны чалавек. Без крыўды, але я заслугоўваю некага лепшага".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""None taken, my friend -- none take..."
links.english: "None taken, my friend -- none taken." He waves his hands. "Let's be honest, there's been some purely fictional talk in our imaginary station in regards of who'd even *be* worthy of your partnership..."
links.polish: „Nic się nie stało, przyjacielu – nic się nie stało” – macha ręką. „Bądźmy szczerzy, na naszym wymyślonym komisariacie toczyły się całkowicie fikcyjne rozmowy na temat tego, kto w ogóle *byłby* godny bycia twoim partnerem...”
links.belarusian: "Нічога не здарылася, сябра — нічога не здарылася", — махае рукой. "Будзем шчырымі, на нашым прыдуманым пастарунку вяліся цалкам фіктыўныя размовы наконт таго, хто наогул *быў бы* варты быць тваім партнёрам..."

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""... and the conclusion is that a m..."
links.english: "... and the conclusion is that a man with your calibre should form his own one-man-policing-unit." He nods eagerly along. "Anyone else would just slow you down."
links.polish: „...i wynikło z nich, że człowiek twojego kalibru powinien stworzyć swój własny jednoosobowy policyjny zespół” – wyjaśnia, przytakując ochoczo. „Każdy partner tylko by cię spowalniał”.
links.belarusian: "...і вынікла з іх, што чалавек твайго калібру павінен стварыць сваю ўласную аднапрацоўную паліцэйскую каманду", – тлумачыць, ажыўлёна ківаючы. "Кожны партнёр толькі б цябе запавольваў".

links.title: You: ""Kim's cooler than you.""
links.english: "Kim's cooler than you."
links.polish: „Kim jest bardziej czadowy od ciebie”.
links.belarusian: "Хто больш круты за цябе".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""I'm sure he's fucking *flattered*,..."
links.english: "I'm sure he's fucking *flattered*, but *Kim* is not part of this thought experiment. In this one -- *we're* partners."
links.polish: „Na pewno *miło mu* to słyszeć, ale *Kim* nie jest częścią tego eksperymentu myślowego. W nim to *my* jesteśmy partnerami”.
links.belarusian: "Напэўна, *прыемна яму* гэта чуць, але *Кім* не з'яўляецца часткай гэтага мысленнага эксперыменту. У ім гэта *мы* з'яўляемся партнёрамі".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant is silent."
links.english: The lieutenant is silent.
links.polish: Porucznik milczy.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант маўчыць.

links.title: You: ""Do *you*... have a crime to solve?""
links.english: "Do *you*... have a crime to solve?"
links.polish: „A *ty*... masz jakąś sprawę do rozwiązania?”
links.belarusian: "А *ты*... маеш якую-небудзь справу для вырашэння?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Oh no, NO, NO! You see, I enjoy wa..."
links.english: "Oh no, NO, NO! You see, I enjoy watching other, better cops solve crimes -- and let me tell you, it's been quite a privilege seeing you work..."
links.polish: „O nie, nie, nie! Wiesz, ja uwielbiam przyglądać się innym, lepszym glinom rozwiązującym sprawy – i muszę wyznać, że oglądanie ciebie przy pracy to prawdziwy zaszczyt...”
links.belarusian: "О, не, не, не! Ведаеш, я абажаю назіраць, як іншыя, лепшыя паліцэйскія разграбаюць справы — і мушу прызнацца, што назіраць за тваёй працай — сапраўдны гонар..."

links.title: Horse-Faced Woman: ""This isn't helping," she says, sha..."
links.english: "This isn't helping," she says, shaking her head and looking at the man with sunglasses disapprovingly.
links.polish: „To w niczym nie pomaga” – stwierdza, kręcąc głową i spoglądając na mężczyznę w okularach przeciwsłonecznych z wyrzutem.
links.belarusian: "Гэта нічым не дапамагае", — кажа ён, круцячы галавой і глядзячы на мужчыну ў сонечных акулярах з дакорам.

links.title: You: ""Who else is in our imaginary polic..."
links.english: "Who else is in our imaginary police station?"
links.polish: „Kto jeszcze pracuje na komisariacie z naszej wyobraźni?”
links.belarusian: "Хто яшчэ працуе ў аддзяленні паліцыі з нашай выяўленчай уяўленасці?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""You're not going to believe this,..."
links.english: "You're not going to believe this, but..." The man pauses for dramatic effect. "... police officers!"
links.polish: „Pewnie nie uwierzysz, ale...” – robi pauzę, aby zwiększyć dramatyzm – „...funkcjonariusze policji!”
links.belarusian: "Напэўна, не паверыш, але..." – робіць паўзу, каб павялічыць драматызм – "...супрацоўнікі міліцыі!"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Yes sir, solving crimes, locking u..."
links.english: "Yes sir, solving crimes, locking up bad guys and... *AND* get this... and *not* getting their drink on at two o'clock."
links.polish: „Tak jest – rozwiązują sprawy, łapią bandziorów i... *wyobraź sobie*... *nie* chleją wódy o drugiej po południu”.
links.belarusian: "Так ёсць – вырашаюць справы, ловяць бандытаў і... *уяві сабе*... *не* п'юць гарэлкі а другой гадзіне дня".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Just some regular boring motherfuc..."
links.english: "Just some regular boring motherfuckers in suits and uniforms. Nothing spectacularly extravagant like you -- the Far Out Son Of Lung."
links.polish: „Po prostu zwykłe, nudne sukinsyny w garniakach i mundurach. Nic tak spektakularnie ekstrawaganckiego jak ty – Odjechany Synu Lunga”.
links.belarusian: "Проста звычайныя, нудныя сукіны сыны ў касцюмах і мундурах. Нічога такога відовішчнага і экстравагантнага, як ты – Задарожны Сын Лунга".

links.title: You: ""Who is the *Far Out Son of Lung*?""
links.english: "Who is the *Far Out Son of Lung*?"
links.polish: „*Odjechany Syn Lunga*? Kto to?”
links.belarusian: "*Адʼеханы Сын Лунга*? Хто гэта?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Oh, it's you, you eccentric genius..."
links.english: "Oh, it's you, you eccentric genius." He winks at you sarcastically. "I mean with your unorthodox approach to police work it *has to* be you."
links.polish: „Och, to jesteś ty – twój ekscentryczny geniusz” – puszcza ci sarkastycznie oko. „W końcu z twoim niekonwencjonalnym podejściem do policyjnej roboty to *musisz* być ty”.
links.belarusian: "Ох, гэта ты — твой эксцэнтрычны геній", — саркастычна падміргвае ён. "У рэшце рэшт, з тваім нетрадыцыйным падыходам да паліцэйскай працы гэта *мусіць* быць ты".

links.title: You: ""Want to tell me more about him? Or..."
links.english: "Want to tell me more about him? Or her?"
links.polish: „Nie chcesz opowiedzieć mi o nim więcej? Czy tam o niej?”
links.belarusian: "Не хочаш расказаць мне пра яго больш? Ці пра яе?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Not even a little bit.""
links.english: "Not even a little bit."
links.polish: „Nie mam na to najmniejszej ochoty”.
links.belarusian: "У мяне няма ні найменшага жадання".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's an urban myth," the lieutenan..."
links.english: "It's an urban myth," the lieutenant says quietly. "About an officer who is so far undercover he can't remember who he is. As I said -- just an urban myth. *You're* not the Son of Lung."
links.polish: „To miejska legenda” – stwierdza cicho porucznik. „Mówi o funkcjonariuszu działającym pod przykrywką, który zapomniał, kim jest. Ale to tylko miejska legenda. Nie *jesteś* synem Lunga”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта гарадская легенда", — ціха кажа лейтэнант. "Яна распавядае пра супрацоўніка, які дзейнічаў пад прыкрыццём і забыўся, хто ён. Але гэта толькі гарадская легенда. Ты не *з"яўляешся* сынам Лунга".

links.title: Empathy: "He's trying to protect you from fur..."
links.english: He's trying to protect you from further rough handling dished out by this sun-glassed man.
links.polish: Próbuje uchronić cię przed dalszymi nieprzyjemnościami ze strony faceta w okularach.
links.belarusian: Стараюся абараніць цябе ад далейшых непрыемнасцяў з боку мужчыны ў акулярах.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Okay, yes -- you get the joke. Leav..."
links.english: Okay, yes -- you get the joke. Leave it at that.
links.polish: Okej, dobra. Zrozumiałeś żart. Na tym poprzestańmy.
links.belarusian: Добра, зразумела. Спынімся на гэтым.

links.title: You: ""I can't imagine it anymore." (Conc..."
links.english: "I can't imagine it anymore." (Conclude.)
links.polish: „Nie umiem sobie tego dłużej wyobrażać” (Zakończ).
links.belarusian: "Не магу сабе гэтага далей уяўляць" (Скончана).

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Neither can I, partner. Neither ca..."
links.english: "Neither can I, partner. Neither can I..." His grey eyes suddenly flash above the glass frames. They feel sad.
links.polish: „Ani ja, partnerze. Ani ja...” – odpowiada. Jego szare oczy nagle pojawiają się przez chwilę nad oprawkami okularów. Widać w nich smutek.
links.belarusian: "Ні я, партнёру. Ні я..." – адказвае ён. Яго шэрыя вочы раптам з"яўляюцца на момант над апраўкамі акуляраў. У іх відаць смутак.

links.title: Empathy: "It's a mere second, but it feels li..."
links.english: It's a mere second, but it feels like you saw something... a gram of compassion in that sadness.
links.polish: Wydaje ci się, że dostrzegłeś w tym smutku coś... jakby odrobinę współczucia.
links.belarusian: Табе здаецца, што заўважыў у гэтым суме штосьці... як бы крыху спагады.

links.title: You: ""Cool shades. Are you wearing a dis..."
links.english: "Cool shades. Are you wearing a disguise?"
links.polish: „Fajowe oksy. To element kamuflażu?”
links.belarusian: "Класныя акуляры. Гэта элемент маскіроўкі?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Yes. It's a hobby of mine." He loo..."
links.english: "Yes. It's a hobby of mine." He looks at you inquisitively.
links.polish: „Tak. Takie mam hobby” – odpowiada, patrząc na ciebie z zaciekawieniem.
links.belarusian: "Так. Такое ў мяне хобі", — адказвае ён, гледзячы на цябе з цікавасцю.

links.title: Rhetoric: "As if waiting for some kind of reac..."
links.english: As if waiting for some kind of reaction, or response -- something to *click*. It's not happening though. Who is this guy?
links.polish: Jakby czekali na jakąś reakcję albo odpowiedź. Aż coś *zaskoczy*. Tyle że nie zaskakuje. Co to za gość?
links.belarusian: Як бы чакалі нейкай рэакцыі альбо адказу. Пакуль нешта *не адбудзецца*. Але не адбываецца. Хто гэта такі госць?

links.title: You: ""Kim... who is this guy?""
links.english: "Kim... who is this guy?"
links.polish: „Kim... Co to za gość?”
links.belarusian: "Кім... Што гэта за госць?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mkm." He shakes his head. "I'm not..."
links.english: "Mkm." He shakes his head. "I'm not getting involved in this."
links.polish: „Khm” – kręci głową. „Nie zamierzam się w to mieszać”.
links.belarusian: "Гм", — паціснуў галавой. "Не збіраюся ў гэта ўмешвацца".

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It's not my style, he thinks, glanc..."
links.english: It's not my style, he thinks, glancing at the man in sunglasses. And the woman beside him. Ooo boy, they're mad at him. No wonder. He just doesn't recognize them.
links.polish: To nie w moim stylu – myśli, patrząc na mężczyznę w okularach. O rany, ale są na niego wściekli. Nie dziwne. On ich po prostu nie poznaje.
links.belarusian: Гэта не ў маім стылі, — думае, гледзячы на мужчыну ў акулярах. Божа мой, але ж яны на яго раззлаваныя. Не дзіўна. Ён іх проста не пазнае.

links.title: You: ""Are you famous or something?""
links.english: "Are you famous or something?"
links.polish: „Jesteś sławny czy coś takiego?”
links.belarusian: "Ты вядомы ці нешта такое?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Not as famous as you, superstar."..."
links.english: "Not as famous as you, superstar." He says without the slightest hint of irony.
links.polish: „Nie tak sławny jak ty, supergwiazdo” – odpowiada bez cienia ironii w głosie.
links.belarusian: "Не такі вядомы, як ты, суперзорка", — адказвае ён без ценю іроніі ў голасе.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Yeah... it's still irony."
links.english: Yeah... it's still irony.
links.polish: Tak... To nadal ironia.
links.belarusian: Так... Гэта ўсё яшчэ іронія.

links.title: You: ""Wait, I'm famous?""
links.english: "Wait, I'm famous?"
links.polish: „Zaraz. Ja jestem sławny?”
links.belarusian: "Пачакайце. Я вядомы?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Oh yes, big time." He nods enthusi..."
links.english: "Oh yes, big time." He nods enthusiastically. "Who hasn't heard of the Far Out Son of Liver Failure?!"
links.polish: „O, i to jak!” – kiwa głową z entuzjazmem. „Kto nie słyszał o Odjechanym Synu Niewydolności Wątroby?!”
links.belarusian: "О, і гэта як!" — ківае галавой з энтузіязмам. "Хто не чуў пра Ад'еханага Сына Недастатковасці Печані?!"

links.title: You: ""Hold on, who's Son of Liver Failur..."
links.english: "Hold on, who's Son of Liver Failure?"
links.polish: „Zaraz, kim jest Syn Niewydolności Wątroby?”
links.belarusian: "Зараз, хто такі Сын Недастатковасці Печані?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""*Far Out* Son of Liver Failure --..."
links.english: "*Far Out* Son of Liver Failure -- the supercop who voluntarily enters an alcohol induced delirium to solve crimes."
links.polish: „*Odjechany* Syn Niewydolności Wątroby – superglina, który z własnej woli wywołuje u siebie alkoholowe delirium, aby rozwiązywać sprawy”.
links.belarusian: "*Ад'еханы* Сын Недастатковасці Пячонкі – суперсалдат, які па сваёй волі выклікае ў сябе алкагольны дылірый, каб вырашаць справы".

links.title: Horse-Faced Woman: "The woman has a slight smirk on her..."
links.english: The woman has a slight smirk on her face.
links.polish: Na ustach kobiety pojawia się uśmieszek.
links.belarusian: На вуснах жанчыны з'явілася ўсмешка.

links.title: Composure: "She's trying to keep a straight fac..."
links.english: She's trying to keep a straight face.
links.polish: Próbuje zachować powagę.
links.belarusian: Спрабую захаваць сур'ёзнасць.

links.title: Conceptualization: "There's a joke you're not getting h..."
links.english: There's a joke you're not getting here. Could have something to do with the brain damage.
links.polish: Padł tu jakiś żart, którego nie rozumiesz. Może to mieć coś wspólnego z twoim uszkodzeniem mózgu.
links.belarusian: Тут прагучаў нейкі жарт, які ты не разумееш. Магчыма, гэта звязана з пашкоджаннем твайго мозга.

links.title: You: ""Fine.""
links.english: "Fine."
links.polish: „Dobrze”.
links.belarusian: "Добра".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""No, not entirely." It's impossible..."
links.english: "No, not entirely." It's impossible to say what his eyes behind the shades are doing.
links.polish: „Nie, niezupełnie” – nie sposób powiedzieć, co robią jego oczy ukryte za przyciemnionymi szkłami okularów.
links.belarusian: "Не, не зусім" — немагчыма сказаць, што робяць яго вочы, схаваныя за прыцемненымі шкламі акуляраў.

links.title: You: ""I knew it, Kim! I knew I was a sup..."
links.english: "I knew it, Kim! I knew I was a superstar."
links.polish: „Wiedziałem, Kim! Wiedziałem, że jestem supergwiazdą”.
links.belarusian: "Я ведаў, Кім! Я ведаў, што я суперзорка".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I fear..." The lieutenant lowers h..."
links.english: "I fear..." The lieutenant lowers his voice. "I fear you're misinterpreting this situation."
links.polish: „Obawiam się...” – odpowiada porucznik, ściszając głos. „Obawiam się, że błędnie interpretujesz tę sytuację”.
links.belarusian: "Баюся..." — адказвае лейтэнант, зніжаючы голас. "Баюся, што ты няправільна тлумачыш гэтую сітуацыю".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Talk to me, superstar. What do you..."
links.english: "Talk to me, superstar. What do you want?"
links.polish: „Mów, supergwiazdo. Czego chcesz?”
links.belarusian: "Кажы, суперзорка. Чаго ты хочаш?"

links.title: You: ""I knew it! I knew I was someone we..."
links.english: "I knew it! I knew I was someone well known. A superstar."
links.polish: „Wiedziałem. Wiedziałem, że jestem kimś znanym. Supergwiazdą”.
links.belarusian: "Я ведаў. Я ведаў, што я вядомы чалавек. Суперзорка".

links.title: Horse-Faced Woman: ""Jean, he's obviously suffering..."..."
links.english: "Jean, he's obviously suffering..." The woman stops mid-sentence.
links.polish: „Jean, przecież widać, że on...” – kobieta urywa wypowiedź w połowie zdania.
links.belarusian: "Жан, але ж бачна, што ён..." – жанчына абрывае сваю прамову на палове сказа.

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: "The man with sunglasses looks at he..."
links.english: The man with sunglasses looks at her -- then back at you: "Okay, superstar. Talk to me, what do you want? You want a pat on the back?"
links.polish: Mężczyzna w okularach przeciwsłonecznych spogląda na nią, a później zwraca się do ciebie: „Dobra, supergwiazdo. Mów – czego chcesz? Chcesz, żeby poklepać cię po pleckach?”
links.belarusian: Мужчына ў сонцаахоўных акулярах глядзіць на яе, а потым звяртаецца да цябе: "Добра, суперзорка. Кажы – чаго хочаш? Хочаш, каб пацукалі цябе па плячах?"

links.title: You: ""It's happening! My hard work is pa..."
links.english: "It's happening! My hard work is paying off! I'm becoming famous!"
links.polish: „Udaje mi się! Moja ciężka praca wreszcie popłaca! Staję się sławny!”
links.belarusian: "У мяне атрымліваецца! Мая цяжкая праца нарэшце апраўдваецца! Я становіцца знакамітым!"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Oh, yes you are! And you've worked..."
links.english: "Oh, yes you are! And you've worked really, *really* hard, haven't you?"
links.polish: „O tak, rzeczywiście! Pracowałeś bardzo, *bardzo* ciężko, prawda?”
links.belarusian: "О так, сапраўды! Ты працаваў вельмі, *вельмі* цяжка, праўда?"

links.title: You: "There's something strange about thi..."
links.english: There's something strange about this guy. Figure it out.
links.polish: Coś jest w tym gościu dziwnego. Dojdź, co to może być.
links.belarusian: Нешта ёсць у гэтым хлопцы дзіўнае. Даведайся, што гэта можа быць.

links.title: You: ""Got some questions for you. I'm a..."
links.english: "Got some questions for you. I'm a cop."
links.polish: „Mam kilka pytań. Jestem policjantem”.
links.belarusian: "У мяне ёсць некалькі пытанняў. Я міліцыянт".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""About *what?* You don't look like..."
links.english: "About *what?* You don't look like a cop..." He inspects you. "You know what you look like?"
links.polish: „O *co*? Nie wyglądasz mi na glinę...” – przygląda ci się uważnie. „Wiesz, jak wyglądasz?”
links.belarusian: "Аб што? Ты не выглядаеш як паліцэйскі..." — уважліва прыглядаецца да цябе. "Ведаеш, як выглядаеш?"

links.title: You: ""Like a prophet?""
links.english: "Like a prophet?"
links.polish: „Jak prorok?”
links.belarusian: "Як прарок?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Not the prophet shit again..." He..."
links.english: "Not the prophet shit again..." He looks away.
links.polish: „Tylko nie ten profetyczny bełkot...” – odpowiada i odwraca wzrok.
links.belarusian: "Толькі не гэты прарочы лямант..." — адказвае і адвяртае позірк.

links.title: Authority: "He didn't answer *your* question."
links.english: He didn't answer *your* question.
links.polish: Nie odpowiedział na *twoje* pytanie.
links.belarusian: Ён не адказаў на *тваё* пытанне.

links.title: Half Light: "Who does this asshole think he is -..."
links.english: Who does this asshole think he is -- a *cop*?
links.polish: Za kogo się ma ten dupek? Za *glinę*?
links.belarusian: За каго сябе прымае гэты дурны чалавек? За *менту*?

links.title: You: ""Like a revolutionary?""
links.english: "Like a revolutionary?"
links.polish: „Jak rewolucjonista?”
links.belarusian: "Як рэвалюцыянер?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""No, not like a revolutionary." He..."
links.english: "No, not like a revolutionary." He looks away.
links.polish: „Nie, nie jak rewolucjonista” – odpowiada i odwraca wzrok.
links.belarusian: "Не, не як рэвалюцыянер", — адказвае ён і адвяртае вочы.

links.title: You: ""Like a sack of shit?""
links.english: "Like a sack of shit?"
links.polish: „Jak wór łajna?”
links.belarusian: "Як мех гною?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Exactly." The man nods excitedly i..."
links.english: "Exactly." The man nods excitedly in approval.
links.polish: „Zgadza się” – mężczyzna przytakuje gorliwie.
links.belarusian: "Гэта дакладна" — мужчына горача ківае.

links.title: You: ""Like a megastar?""
links.english: "Like a megastar?"
links.polish: „Jak megagwiazda?”
links.belarusian: "Як мегазорка?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Yes." He nods. "A superstar cop. O..."
links.english: "Yes." He nods. "A superstar cop. Of course. *This* again."
links.polish: „Tak” – kiwa głową. „Supergwiazdorski glina. Oczywiście. Znowu *to*”.
links.belarusian: "Так" — ківае галавой. "Суперзоркавы паліцэйскі. Вядома. Зноў *гэта*".

links.title: You: ""Like Guillaume Le...""
links.english: "Like Guillaume Le..."
links.polish: „Jak Guillaume le...”
links.belarusian: "Як Гійом ле..."

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""NO!" The man in the sunglasses rai..."
links.english: "NO!" The man in the sunglasses raises his fist. "You will not start blabbering about that asshole."
links.polish: „Nie!!” – wykrzykuje i unosi zaciśniętą dłoń. „Nie będziesz mi tu bełkotał o tym dupku”.
links.belarusian: "Не!!" — крычыць ён і падымае сціснутую далонь. "Не будзеш мне тут мямліць пра гэтага падлюгу".

links.title: You: ""Like... Kras Mazov?""
links.english: "Like... Kras Mazov?"
links.polish: „Jak... Kras Mazow?”
links.belarusian: "Як... Крас Мазоў?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Yeaaah..." He's rubbing his chin a..."
links.english: "Yeaaah..." He's rubbing his chin as he drags out the *yeah*. "Sort of. Okay. I get the reference. Like after he got run over or something."
links.polish: „Taaa...” – odpowiada przeciągle, pocierając przy tym brodę. „Tak jakby. Okej. Dostrzegam podobieństwo. Wyglądałby tak, gdyby go przejechali czy coś”.
links.belarusian: "Тааа..." — адказвае павольна, пацерці падбародак. "Так як быццам. Окей. Бачу падабенства. Вонкава так выглядаў бы, калі б яго пераехалі ці нешта".

links.title: You: ""I don't know -- you tell me.""
links.english: "I don't know -- you tell me."
links.polish: „Nie wiem. Ty mi powiedz”.
links.belarusian: "Не ведаю. Ты мне скажы".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""I don't know..." He taps on his fo..."
links.english: "I don't know..." He taps on his forehead, thinking. "A sad stack of shit?"
links.polish: „Nie wiem...” – postukuje dłonią w czoło, myśląc. „Żałosny wór łajna?”
links.belarusian: "Не ведаю…" — стукае далонню па ілбу, думаючы. "Жаласны мях навозу?"

Alternate1.english: "I don't know..." He taps on his forehead, thinking. "A sad stack of shit? Next to someone far more proficient."
Alternate1.polish: „Nie wiem...” – postukuje dłonią w czoło, myśląc. „Żałosny wór łajna? Stojący obok kogoś znacznie bardziej skutecznego”.
Alternate1.belarusian: «Не ведаю…» — б’е сябе рукой па ілбе, думаючы. «Жаласны мяшок гною? Стаіць побач з кімсьці значна больш паспяховым».

links.title: You: ""Like a man down on his luck? I'm t..."
links.english: "Like a man down on his luck? I'm trying real hard here, man."
links.polish: „Jak przeklęty pechowiec? Staram się jak mogę, chłopie”.
links.belarusian: "Як пракляты няўдачнік? Стараюся, як магу, хлопча".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Oh..." He seems taken aback for a..."
links.english: "Oh..." He seems taken aback for a moment. "Well, go solve your case then. That would count as *trying hard*."
links.polish: „O...” – przez chwilę sprawia wrażenie zbitego z tropu. „W takim razie rozwiąż swoją sprawę. To by się liczyło jako »staranie się«”.
links.belarusian: "О..." — на момант выглядае разгубленым. "У такім разе разваж сваю праблему. Гэта залічыцца як "імкненне"".

links.title: You: ""Let's talk about the hanged man *a..."
links.english: "Let's talk about the hanged man *again*."
links.polish: „Porozmawiajmy *jeszcze raz* o tym wisielcu”.
links.belarusian: "Пагаворым *яшчэ раз* пра гэтага вісельніка".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Okay, why not. Let's do the whole..."
links.english: "Okay, why not. Let's do the whole thing over again. We're not wasting time. There *is* no time!"
links.polish: „Dobra, czemu nie. Omówmy to wszystko jeszcze raz od nowa. Nie marnujemy czasu. Bo *nie ma* czasu!”
links.belarusian: "Добра, чаму не. Абмяркуем гэта ўсё яшчэ раз з пачатку. Не марнуем часу. Бо *няма* часу!"

links.title: You: ""Okay I'm doing this investigation..."
links.english: "Okay I'm doing this investigation -- a man is hanged."
links.polish: „No więc prowadzę śledztwo. Powieszono człowieka”.
links.belarusian: "Таму я вяду расследаванне. Чалавека павесілі".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""So... do you know who hanged him?""
links.english: "So... do you know who hanged him?"
links.polish: „Więc... Nie wiesz, kto go powiesił?”
links.belarusian: "Дык... Ты не ведаеш, хто яго павесіў?"

links.title: You: ""Not yet.""
links.english: "Not yet."
links.polish: „Jeszcze nie”.
links.belarusian: "Яшчэ не".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Yeah, I can see that.""
links.english: "Yeah, I can see that."
links.polish: „Taa, widać”.
links.belarusian: "Так, бачна".

links.title: You: ""Hey, why am I even telling you thi..."
links.english: "Hey, why am I even telling you this?"
links.polish: „Hej, czemu ja ci to w ogóle mówię?”
links.belarusian: "Гэй, чаму я табе гэта ўвогуле кажу?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""I don't know... why are you?" He g..."
links.english: "I don't know... why are you?" He gives you an odd look.
links.polish: „Nie wiem... Dlaczego?” – pyta, rzucając ci dziwne spojrzenie.
links.belarusian: "Не ведаю... Чаму?" – пытаецца яна, кідаючы на цябе дзіўны позірк.

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Oh my god, there's more..." He loo..."
links.english: "Oh my god, there's more..." He looks at you in disbelief. "You want something more... what is it?"
links.polish: „O mój boże, to nie wszystko...” – przygląda ci się z niedowierzaniem. „Chodzi ci o coś jeszcze... O co?”
links.belarusian: "О, Божа мой, гэта яшчэ не ўсё..." – гледзіць на цябе з недаверам. "Справа ў нечым яшчэ... У чым?"

links.title: Logic: "It's like you felt it would be inte..."
links.english: It's like you felt it would be intellectually stimulating -- and would lead somewhere. A custom even? Strange...
links.polish: Jakbyś czuł, że będzie to intelektualnie stymulujące i do czegoś doprowadzi. Coś niemal jak obyczaj? Dziwne...
links.belarusian: Як бы ты адчуваў, што гэта будзе інтэлектуальна стымулюючым і да чагосьці прывядзе. Нешта амаль як звычка? Дзівосна...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Who knows why we do the things we d..."
links.english: Who knows why we do the things we do. Somehow bouncing those ideas off the man with sunglasses felt calming. Like you've done it before.
links.polish: Kto wie, czemu robimy to, co robimy? Z jakiegoś powodu rozmowa o tym wszystkim z mężczyzną w okularach cię uspokoiła. Jakbyś już kiedyś to robił.
links.belarusian: Хто ведае, чаму мы робім тое, што робім? З нейкай прычыны размова пра ўсё гэта з мужчынам у акулярах цябе супакоіла. Як быццам ты ўжо калісьці гэта рабіў.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "You know what? It must be because h..."
links.english: You know what? It must be because he's *buff*. He looks like he works out like he's got the devil on his back.
links.polish: Wiesz co? To chyba dlatego, że jest *napakowany*. Wygląda, jakby sam diabeł go zaganiał na siłownię.
links.belarusian: Ведаеш што? Гэта, напэўна, таму што ён *напампаваны*. Выглядае, быццам сам чорт яго заганяў у трэнажорную залу.

links.title: You: ""Okay, I'm doing this investigation..."
links.english: "Okay, I'm doing this investigation and it turns out he was shot *and* hanged..."
links.polish: „No dobra. Prowadzę śledztwo i okazuje się, że facet został nie tylko powieszony, ale i *zastrzelony*...”
links.belarusian: "Ну добра. Я вядзy расследаванне і выяўляецца, што мужчына быў не толькі павешаны, але і *застрэлены*…"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""You think he was hanged as a cover..."
links.english: "You think he was hanged as a coverup? To hide the shooting?"
links.polish: „Myślisz, że powieszono go, żeby zatrzeć ślady? Żeby ukryć postrzał?”
links.belarusian: "Ты думаеш, яго павесілі, каб схаваць сляды? Каб схаваць стрэл?"

links.title: You: ""Basically -- yes.""
links.english: "Basically -- yes."
links.polish: „W gruncie rzeczy – właśnie tak”.
links.belarusian: "Насамрэч — менавіта так".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Okay. Well..." He corrects his blo..."
links.english: "Okay. Well..." He corrects his blonde wig. Khm... his hair. He corrects his hair.
links.polish: „Okej. Cóż...” – poprawia swoją blond perukę. Znaczy... swoje włosy. Poprawia swoje włosy.
links.belarusian: "Добра. Што ж..." – папраўляе сваю бландынку-парык. Гэта значыць... свае валасы. Папраўляе свае валасы.

links.title: You: ""Hey, why am I telling you this?""
links.english: "Hey, why am I telling you this?"
links.polish: „Hej, czemu ja ci to mówię?”
links.belarusian: "Гэй, чаму я кажу табе гэта?"

links.title: You: ""Okay, this person who was shot and..."
links.english: "Okay, this person who was shot and then made to look like he was hanged -- he *might* have been shot by the people who hanged him."
links.polish: „No więc ten człowiek, co został zastrzelony, a potem zrobili, że niby został powieszony – *możliwe*, że zastrzelili go ci sami ludzie, co go powiesili”.
links.belarusian: "Дык вось той чалавек, якога застрэлілі, а потым зрабілі выгляд, што павесілі – *магчыма*, яго забілі тыя ж людзі, што яго павесілі".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""I get it. Okay. But what is the mo..."
links.english: "I get it. Okay. But what is the motive?"
links.polish: „Łapię. Okej. Ale jaki mieli motyw?”
links.belarusian: "Зразумела. Добра. Але які быў у іх матыў?"

links.title: You: ""To cover something up?""
links.english: "To cover something up?"
links.polish: „Żeby coś ukryć?”
links.belarusian: "Каб нешта схаваць?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""That would be my first guess, yes.""
links.english: "That would be my first guess, yes."
links.polish: „Tak, też bym tak założył”.
links.belarusian: "Так, я таксама б так меркаваў".

links.title: You: ""It's quite possible... hey! Why am..."
links.english: "It's quite possible... hey! Why am I telling you these things?"
links.polish: „To całkiem możliwe... Hej! Czemu ja ci mówię te rzeczy?”
links.belarusian: "Гэта цалкам магчыма... Эй! Чаму я табе распавядаю гэтыя рэчы?"

links.title: You: ""Okay, the person who was shot and..."
links.english: "Okay, the person who was shot and hanged. He may have been shot by the person who made it look like he was hanged."
links.polish: „No to co do tego zastrzelonego i powieszonego gościa – *możliwe*, że zastrzeliła go ta osoba, która potem upozorowała powieszenie”.
links.belarusian: "Ну, што да гэтага застрэленага і павешанага хлопца – *магчыма*, яго застрэліла тая асоба, якая потым сфальсіфікавала павешанне".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""A cover-up -- where the author of..."
links.english: "A cover-up -- where the author of the cover-up is the perp? Makes sense."
links.polish: „Przykrywka, której pomysłodawca jest też zabójcą? To ma sens”.
links.belarusian: "Ахоўка, пра якую прыдумка таксама з'яўляецца забойцам? Гэта мае сэнс".

links.title: You: ""I know, right? But what's the moti..."
links.english: "I know, right? But what's the motive?"
links.polish: „No właśnie. Ale jaki może być motyw?”
links.belarusian: "Вось менавіта. Але які можа быць матыў?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""You don't have a motive? Then the..."
links.english: "You don't have a motive? Then the double cover-up seems too neat."
links.polish: „Nie masz motywu? W takim razie podwójna przykrywka wydaje się zbyt schludna”.
links.belarusian: "Няма матыву? У такім разе падвойная прыкрыць лічыцца занадта акуратнай".

links.title: You: ""Yeah... hey, why am I telling you..."
links.english: "Yeah... hey, why am I telling you these things?"
links.polish: „Tak... Hej, czemu ja ci mówię te rzeczy?”
links.belarusian: "Так... Гэй, чаму я кажу табе гэтыя рэчы?"

links.title: You: ""The person who we *think* shot him..."
links.english: "The person who we *think* shot him -- who made it look like he was hanged, that we're looking for -- we can't find her."
links.polish: „Ta osoba, która, jak *sądzimy*, go powiesiła – ta, co upozorowała powieszenie i co jej szukamy, tak? To nie możemy jej znaleźć”.
links.belarusian: "Та асоба, якая, як *мы лічым*, яго павесіла – тая, што інсцэніравала павешанне і якую мы шукаем, так? Мы не можам яе знайсці".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Well... where have you looked for..."
links.english: "Well... where have you looked for her?"
links.polish: „Cóż... A gdzie jej szukaliście?”
links.belarusian: "Ну… А дзе вы яе шукалі?"

links.title: You: ""We think she may be on the coast.""
links.english: "We think she may be on the coast."
links.polish: „Podejrzewamy, że może być na wybrzeżu”.
links.belarusian: "Падазраем, што ён можа быць на ўзбярэжжы".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""West of here? Though luck. The pla..."
links.english: "West of here? Though luck. The place is ruined from the bombardment. A lot of places to hide there..."
links.polish: „Na zachód stąd? Kiepsko. Ta okolica jest zniszczona bombardowaniem. Mnóstwo miejsc do ukrywania się...”
links.belarusian: "На захад адсюль? Дрэнна. Гэтая мясцовасць знішчана бамбаваннямі. Шмат месцаў для хавання..."

links.title: You: ""Well, yeah... hey, why am I tellin..."
links.english: "Well, yeah... hey, why am I telling you these things?"
links.polish: „No, tak... Hej, czemu ja ci mówię te rzeczy?”
links.belarusian: "Ну, так... Гэй, чаму я табе кажу гэтыя рэчы?"

links.title: You: ""I have a little problem. The perso..."
links.english: "I have a little problem. The person who was hanged is still hanging there. I still haven't taken him down."
links.polish: „Mam mały problem. Powieszona osoba ciągle tam wisi. Nadal jej nie ściągnąłem”.
links.belarusian: "У мяне невялікая праблема. Павешаны чалавек усё яшчэ там вісіць. Яго яшчэ не зняў".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""You're not shitting me, Mullen. I..."
links.english: "You're not shitting me, Mullen. I can smell it all the way here. The whole town stinks."
links.polish: „Nie ściemniasz, Mullen. Czuję go aż tutaj. Śmierdzi w całym mieście”.
links.belarusian: "Не махлюй, Мулен. Я адчуваю яго нават тут. Смярдзіць на ўвесь горад".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We're getting to it... There have..."
links.english: "We're getting to it... There have been complications."
links.polish: „Weźmiemy się za to... Wystąpiły komplikacje”.
links.belarusian: "Возьмемся за гэта... Узніклі ўскладненні".

links.title: You: ""Wait -- can *you* maybe help?""
links.english: "Wait -- can *you* maybe help?"
links.polish: „Zaraz. A może *ty* byś mi pomógł?”
links.belarusian: "Пачакай. А можа *ты* мне дапаможаш?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""I would love to -- but I'm busy *f..."
links.english: "I would love to -- but I'm busy *fucking off and not cramping your style*. And that might cramp it, you see. Helping you."
links.polish: „Bardzo bym chciał, ale jestem zajęty *odpierdalaniem się i nieburzeniem twojego stylu*. A to mogłoby go zburzyć. Pomaganie ci”.
links.belarusian: "Вельмі б хацеў, але заняты *адкрываннем сябе і не парушэннем твайго стылю*. А гэта магло б яго парушыць. Дапамагаць табе".

links.title: You: ""Hey... why am I even telling you t..."
links.english: "Hey... why am I even telling you these things?"
links.polish: „Hej... czemu ja ci to wszystko w ogóle mówię?”
links.belarusian: "Гэй... чаму я ўвогуле табе ўсё гэта распавядаю?"

links.title: You: ""*Now* will you answer some questio..."
links.english: "*Now* will you answer some questions for me?"
links.polish: „A *teraz* odpowiesz mi na kilka pytań?”
links.belarusian: "А *цяпер* адкажаш мне на некалькі пытанняў?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""No," he says calmly, then just kee..."
links.english: "No," he says calmly, then just keeps staring at you.
links.polish: „Nie” – odpowiada spokojnie i po prostu nadal się w ciebie wpatruje.
links.belarusian: "Не", — адказвае спакойна і проста працягвае глядзець на цябе.

links.title: You: ""Why not?""
links.english: "Why not?"
links.polish: „Dlaczego?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Cause it's not my job. Why don't y..."
links.english: "Cause it's not my job. Why don't you go and fucking do yours and solve this damn hanging?"
links.polish: „Bo to nie moje zadanie. Może byś w końcu ruszył dupę, zaczął wykonywać swoją robotę i rozwiązał tę cholerną sprawę wisielca?”
links.belarusian: "Бо гэта не маё заданне. Можа, ты нарэшце б парушыў зад і пачаў выконваць сваю працу і вырашыў гэтую праклятую справу вісельніка?"

links.title: You: ""If you don't want to answer questi..."
links.english: "If you don't want to answer questions maybe you want to hear me *say things?*"
links.polish: „Skoro nie chcesz odpowiadać na pytania, to może chcesz posłuchać, jak *mówię różne rzeczy*?”
links.belarusian: "Калі ты не хочаш адказваць на пытанні, то, магчыма, хочаш паслухаць, як *я кажу розныя рэчы*?"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Actually, I *don't* want to hear y..."
links.english: "Actually, I *don't* want to hear you say things."
links.polish: „Właściwie *nie* chcę słuchać, jak coś mówisz”.
links.belarusian: "На самай справе *не* хачу слухаць, як ты нешта кажаш".

links.title: Horse-Faced Woman: ""C'mon, Jean...""
links.english: "C'mon, Jean..."
links.polish: „Daj spokój, Jean...”
links.belarusian: "Адвязіся, Жан…"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Okay. Say things." He adopts a lig..."
links.english: "Okay. Say things." He adopts a lighter tone. "I want to hear you say things."
links.polish: „Dobra. Mów coś” – odpowiada weselszym tonem. „Chcę słuchać, jak coś mówisz”.
links.belarusian: "Добра. Гавары нешта", — адказвае вясёлым тонам. "Хачу слухаць, як ты нешта кажаш".

links.title: Authority: "Hear that? He wants you to say thin..."
links.english: Hear that? He wants you to say things. Say one!
links.polish: Słyszysz to? Chce, żebyś mówił rzeczy. Więc mów!
links.belarusian: Чуеш гэта? Хачу, каб ты казаў рэчы. Дык кажы!

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Suddenly, out of nowhere, case-rela..."
links.english: Suddenly, out of nowhere, case-related things start popping up in your head!
links.polish: Nagle, jakby znikąd, w głowie pojawiają ci się rzeczy związane ze sprawą!
links.belarusian: Раптам, нібы з ніадкуль, у галаве з'яўляюцца рэчы, звязаныя са справай!

links.title: You: ""Let's talk about something else th..."
links.english: "Let's talk about something else then."
links.polish: „To porozmawiajmy o czym innym”.
links.belarusian: "Давайце пагаворым пра нешта іншае".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Or...OR..." The man with sunglasse..."
links.english: "Or...OR..." The man with sunglasses raises his index finger. "We could go back to doing our jobs. This was stupid..."
links.polish: „Albo... ALBO...” – mężczyzna w okularach przeciwsłonecznych unosi palec wskazujący. „Moglibyśmy wrócić do swoich zajęć. Wiem, to głupi pomysł...”
links.belarusian: "Або... АБО..." – мужчына ў сонцаахоўных акулярах падымае ўказальны палец. "Маглі б мы вярнуцца да сваіх спраў. Ведаю, гэта дурная ідэя..."

links.title: You: ""Don't you *have* to?""
links.english: "Don't you *have* to?"
links.polish: „A nie *musisz*?”
links.belarusian: "А ты не *павінен*?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, he doesn't.""
links.english: "No, he doesn't."
links.polish: „Nie, nie musi”.
links.belarusian: "Не, не павінен".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""If I wasn't clinically depressed,..."
links.english: "If I wasn't clinically depressed, I'd burst out laughing." He doesn't look amused. "But I'm gonna go with *no* right now."
links.polish: „Gdybym nie miał depresji klinicznej, to wybuchnąłbym śmiechem” – odpowiada. Nie wygląda na rozbawionego. „Ale ograniczę się na razie do »nie«”.
links.belarusian: "Калі б у мяне не было клінічнай дэпрэсіі, я б заліўся смехам", – адказвае ён. Ён не выглядае забаўленым. "Але пакуль я абмяжуюся "не"".

links.title: You: ""Fine.""
links.english: "Fine."
links.polish: „Dobrze”.
links.belarusian: "Добра".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: "The man in sunglasses nods."
links.english: The man in sunglasses nods.
links.polish: Mężczyzna w okularach przeciwsłonecznych kiwa głową.
links.belarusian: Мужчына ў сонечных акулярах ківае галавой.

links.title: You: ""Okay then. See you around!" [Leave..."
links.english: "Okay then. See you around!" [Leave.]
links.polish: „No dobrze. Do zobaczenia!” [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Ну добра. Да сустрэчы!" [Сыходзіць].

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: "Again he provides no reply, instead..."
links.english: Again he provides no reply, instead seemingly trying to get a better look of your attire through his sunglasses.
links.polish: Kolejny raz nie odpowiada. Zamiast tego najwyraźniej próbuje przyjrzeć się twojemu strojowi przez swoje okulary przeciwsłoneczne.
links.belarusian: Яшчэ раз не адказвае. Замест гэтага відавочна спрабуе разгледзець твой строй праз свае сонечныя акуляры.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Good luck, these look darker than w..."
links.english: Good luck, these look darker than welding glasses.
links.polish: Powodzenia, chyba nawet maska spawalnicza ma jaśniejsze szkło.
links.belarusian: Поспехаў, здаецца, нават у зварачнай масцы больш светлае шкло.

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: "The man doesn't reply. He's too bus..."
links.english: The man doesn't reply. He's too busy furiously squinting at you.
links.polish: Mężczyzna nie odpowiada. Jest zbyt zajęty zaciekłym mrużeniem oczu.
links.belarusian: Мужчына не адказвае. Ён занадта заняты лютым прымружваннем вачэй.

links.title: Logic: "Trying to get a good picture of you..."
links.english: Trying to get a good picture of your jacket, no doubt.
links.polish: Na pewno chce się dobrze przyjrzeć twojej kurtce.
links.belarusian: Вядома, хочацца добра разгледзець тваю куртку.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Can he even see through those glass..."
links.english: Can he even see through those glasses?
links.polish: Czy on w ogóle coś widzi przez te okulary?
links.belarusian: Ці ён наогул нешта бачыць праз гэтыя акуляры?

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Watch out for yourself, loser!""
links.english: "Watch out for yourself, loser!"
links.polish: „Uważaj na siebie, frajerze!”
links.belarusian: "Сачы за сабой, дурань!"

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "That voice... so very familiar... D..."
links.english: That voice... so very familiar... Did you hear it when calling to your station and reporting your badge missing?
links.polish: Ten głos... Taki znajomy... Czy ty go nie słyszałeś, kiedy połączyłeś się z komisariatem i meldowałeś o zaginięciu odznaki?
links.belarusian: Гэты голас... Такі знаёмы... Ці ты яго не чуў, калі звязваўся з аддзелам міліцыі і паведамляў пра згубу знака?

links.title: You: ""Wait, your voice... I recognize it.""
links.english: "Wait, your voice... I recognize it."
links.polish: „Zaraz, twój głos... Poznaję go”.
links.belarusian: "Пачакай, тваюго голас... Я яго пазнаю".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Oh really?! I wonder where?!""
links.english: "Oh really?! I wonder where?!"
links.polish: „Poważnie?! Ciekawe skąd?!”
links.belarusian: "Сур'ёзна?! Цікава, адкуль?!"

links.title: You: ""I lost my badge recently. When I c..."
links.english: "I lost my badge recently. When I called in to report it missing, you were there."
links.polish: „Zgubiłem niedawno odznakę. Kiedy to zgłaszałem, usłyszałem ciebie”.
links.belarusian: "Нядаўна я згубіў значок. Калі я пра гэта паведамляў, я пачуў цябе".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant goes pale. 'No badge..."
links.english: The lieutenant goes pale. 'No badge?' he mouths to himself silently.
links.polish: Porucznik blednie. „Brak odznaki?” – pyta sam siebie bezgłośnie.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант бляднее. "Адсутнасць знака?" – пытаецца сам у сябе моўчкі.

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: "*"That's* where you remember me fro..."
links.english: *"That's* where you remember me from?"
links.polish: „To *stąd* mnie pamiętasz?”
links.belarusian: "Адсюль ты мяне памятаеш?"

links.title: You: ""Yes. I haven't seen you before.""
links.english: "Yes. I haven't seen you before."
links.polish: „Tak. Nigdy wcześniej cię nie widziałem”.
links.belarusian: "Так. Ніколі раней цябе не бачыў".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Okay then. It's probably a *coinci..."
links.english: "Okay then. It's probably a *coincidence*. People sound alike. Good bye."
links.polish: „W porządku. To pewnie *zbieg okoliczności*. Wiele osób brzmi podobnie. Żegnam”.
links.belarusian: "У парадку. Гэта, напэўна, *супадзенне*. Шмат людзей гукаюць падобна. Бывай".

links.title: You: ""Maybe...""
links.english: "Maybe..."
links.polish: „Może...”
links.belarusian: "Можа..."

links.title: You: ""Khm... I have a bit of..." (Point..."
links.english: "Khm... I have a bit of..." (Point to you head.) "Memory trouble."
links.polish: „Khm... Mam trochę...” (Wskaż na swoją głowę). „Kłopotów z pamięcią”.
links.belarusian: "Гм... У мяне трохі..." (Паказаць на сваю галаву). "Праблемы з памяццю".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""You don't say?" He turns away from..."
links.english: "You don't say?" He turns away from you. "Good bye then. The voice thing was a *coincidence*. Run along, asshole."
links.polish: „Poważnie?” – pyta i odwraca się od ciebie. „W takim razie żegnam. To z głosem to był *zbieg okoliczności*. Idź już sobie, dupku”.
links.belarusian: "Сур"ёзна?" — пытае яна і адвяртаецца ад цябе. "У такім разе бывай. Гэта з голасам быў *збег абставін*. Ідзі ўжо, дурню".

links.title: You: "It's probably nothing. [Leave.]"
links.english: It's probably nothing. [Leave.]
links.polish: To pewnie nic ważnego. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: Гэта, напэўна, нічога важнага. [Адыдзі].

links.title: Drama: "He might be wearing a disguise."
links.english: He might be wearing a disguise.
links.polish: Może mieć też na sobie przebranie.
links.belarusian: Ён таксама можа быць у касцюме.

dialogueTree.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""You look like shit." Your ruffled..."
dialogueTree.english: "You look like shit." Your ruffled face reflects in the man's sunglasses.
dialogueTree.polish: „Wyglądasz chujowo” – twoja zmaltretowana twarz odbija się w okularach mężczyzny.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Ты выглядаеш паршыва" — тваё збітае твар адлюстроўваецца ў акулярах мужчыны.

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""And I don't mean that as a metapho..."
links.english: "And I don't mean that as a metaphor."
links.polish: „I nie mówię tego w przenośni”.
links.belarusian: "І я не кажу гэтага ў пераносным сэнсе".

links.title: Conceptualization: "You can't leave it like that -- spi..."
links.english: You can't leave it like that -- spin it on its head. ENGAGE CAPS LOCK.
links.polish: Nie możesz tego tak zostawić – zepchnij go do defensywy. ZAŁĄCZAJ CAPS LOCKA.
links.belarusian: Вы не можаце гэтага так пакінуць – штурхніце яго ў абарону. УКЛЮЧАЙЦЕ CAPS LOCK.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "No, you don't -- you look like a yo..."
links.english: No, you don't -- you look like a young god.
links.polish: Nie, to nieprawda. Wyglądasz jak młody bóg.
links.belarusian: Не, гэта няпраўда. Ты выглядаеш, як малады бог.

links.title: You: ""I LOOK LIKE A BURNING SUN.""
links.english: "I LOOK LIKE A BURNING SUN."
links.polish: „WYGLĄDAM JAK PŁONĄCE SŁOŃCE”.
links.belarusian: "ВЫГЛЯДАЮ ЯК ПАЛЮЧАЕ СОНЦА".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""What?""
links.english: "What?"
links.polish: „Co?”
links.belarusian: "Што?"

links.title: Conceptualization: "Push it more. Harder. Be *more* int..."
links.english: Push it more. Harder. Be *more* intelligent.
links.polish: Ciśniesz. Mocniej. Bądź *jeszcze* inteligentniejszy.
links.belarusian: Ты ціснеш. Мацней. Будзь *яшчэ* разумнейшы.

links.title: You: ""I mean the likeness of the holy su..."
links.english: "I mean the likeness of the holy sun in the sky. I LOOK LIKE IT."
links.polish: „Mam na myśli podobiznę świętego słońca na niebie. TAK WŁAŚNIE WYGLĄDAM”.
links.belarusian: "Я маю на ўвазе выява святога сонца на небе. ВОСЬ ТАК Я І ВЫГЛЯДАЮ".

links.title: You: ""*You* look like shit, asshole!""
links.english: "*You* look like shit, asshole!"
links.polish: „*Sam* wyglądasz chujowo, dupku!”
links.belarusian: "Сам выглядаеш херова, мудак!"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Wow... You seem stable. And in con..."
links.english: "Wow... You seem stable. And in control. Allow me to say, alcohol really seems to have had a positive effect on you."
links.polish: „No... Wydajesz się stabilny. I zachowujesz kontrolę. Alkohol rzeczywiście ma na ciebie pozytywny wpływ”.
links.belarusian: "Не... Ты выглядаеш стабільным. І трымаеш кантроль. Алкаголь сапраўды мае на цябе станоўчы ўплыў".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Now, what do you want?" His tone i..."
links.english: "Now, what do you want?" His tone is impatient.
links.polish: „To czego chcesz?” – pyta zniecierpliwionym tonem.
links.belarusian: "Чаго ты хочаш?" – спытвае нецярплівым тонам.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There's something about this guy th..."
links.english: There's something about this guy that *matches* with a face in your head. A similar, but different face.
links.polish: Coś w tym gościu *pasuje* do twarzy, którą masz gdzieś w pamięci. Jest podobny, a jednak inny.
links.belarusian: Штосьці ў гэтым госці *падобнае* на твар, які ты недзе памятаеш. Ён падобны, але ўсё ж такі іншы.

links.title: Logic: "The suit, the sunglasses, the hairc..."
links.english: The suit, the sunglasses, the haircut... he's *famous*. That's how you know his face.
links.polish: Garnitur, okulary, fryzura... Jest *sławny*. To stąd znasz jego twarz.
links.belarusian: Касцюм, акуляры, прычоска... Ён *знакаміты*. Таму ты ведаеш яго твар.

links.title: Composure: "Okay, so this guy is cool -- he sta..."
links.english: Okay, so this guy is cool -- he stands there like a statue. An *angry* statue. And he does *not* like you.
links.polish: No dobra, gość jest spokojny. Stoi niczym posąg. *Gniewny* posąg. Który cię *nie lubi*.
links.belarusian: Ну добра, госць спакойны. Стаіць нібы статуя. *Злы* статуя. Які цябе *не любіць*.

links.title: Suggestion: "Don't even try to win him over. You..."
links.english: Don't even try to win him over. You won't.
links.polish: Nawet nie próbuj go do siebie przekonać. Nie dasz rady.
links.belarusian: Нават не спрабуй пераканаць яго. У цябе не атрымаецца.

links.title: You: ""I don't look like shit!""
links.english: "I don't look like shit!"
links.polish: „Nie wyglądam chujowo!”
links.belarusian: "Я не выглядаю дрэнна!"

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Judit," He turns to the woman next..."
links.english: "Judit," He turns to the woman next to him. "Back me up here."
links.polish: „Judit” – zwraca się do kobiety obok. „Potrzebuję twojego wsparcia”.
links.belarusian: "Юдыт", — звяртаецца ён да жанчыны побач. "Мне патрэбная твая падтрымка".

links.title: Horse-Faced Woman: ""You do look..." She sighs. "It loo..."
links.english: "You do look..." She sighs. "It looks like it's been a tough week for him."
links.polish: „Wyglądasz...” – wzdycha. „To był dla niego najwyraźniej ciężki tydzień”.
links.belarusian: "Выглядаеш..." – уздыхае ён. "Гэта быў, відаць, цяжкі тыдзень для яго".

links.title: You: ""I know, it's intentional.""
links.english: "I know, it's intentional."
links.polish: „Wiem, to zamierzone”.
links.belarusian: "Ведаю, гэта наўмысна".

links.title: Horse-Faced Woman: ""Like undercover?" The woman in the..."
links.english: "Like undercover?" The woman in the RCM uniform interjects.
links.polish: „To przykrywka?” – wtrąca się kobieta w mundurze MOR-u.
links.belarusian: "Гэта прыкрыццё?" — умешваецца жанчына ў уніформе РГМ.

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Well, as far as disguises go, this..."
links.english: "Well, as far as disguises go, this is one of the best I've seen... I mean, I could swear you're an actual bum!"
links.polish: „Jeśli to jest przebranie, to nigdy jeszcze nie widziałem równie dobrego... Mógłbym przysiąc, że jesteś prawdziwym menelem!”
links.belarusian: "Калі гэта маскіроўка, то я ніколі раней не бачыў гэткай добрай... Мог бы паклясціся, што ты сапраўдны жабрак!"

links.title: You: ""The last couple of days have been..."
links.english: "The last couple of days have been rough..."
links.polish: „To było ciężkich kilka dni...”
links.belarusian: "Гэта былі цяжкія некалькі дзён..."

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Oh don't be so modest, we're looki..."
links.english: "Oh don't be so modest, we're looking at several months' worth of damage here. Kind of a miracle you're still up and at it, to be honest..."
links.polish: „Och, nie bądź taki skromny – podziwiamy spustoszenie, na które pracowałeś kilkanaście miesięcy. To cud, że wciąż jesteś na chodzie, szczerze mówiąc...”
links.belarusian: "Ох, не будзь такі сціплы — мы захапляемся тым спусташэннем, над якім ты працаваў некалькі месяцаў. Гэта цуд, што ты ўсё яшчэ на хаду, шчыра кажучы..."

links.title: Horse-Faced Woman: ""C'mon, Jean..." The woman next to..."
links.english: "C'mon, Jean..." The woman next to him sighs. "It looks like it's been a rough week on him."
links.polish: „Daj spokój, Jean...” – wzdycha kobieta obok niego. „To był dla niego najwyraźniej ciężki tydzień”.
links.belarusian: "Дай спакой, Жан..." — уздыхае жанчына побач з ім. "Гэта быў для яго, відаць, цяжкі тыдзень".

Alternate1.english: "C'mon, Jean... It looks like it's been a rough week on him."
Alternate1.polish: „Daj spokój, Jean... To był dla niego najwyraźniej ciężki tydzień”.
Alternate1.belarusian: «Дай спакой, Жан... Гэта быў для яго, відавочна, цяжкі тыдзень».

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""It's not just this week." He scans..."
links.english: "It's not just this week." He scans you from head to toe. "What do you want?"
links.polish: „Nie tylko ten tydzień” – przygląda ci się od stóp po czubek głowy. „Czego chcesz?”
links.belarusian: "Не толькі гэты тыдзень" — глядзіць на цябе ад пят да макушкі. "Чаго хочаш?"

links.title: You: ""Looks don't matter, it's what's on..."
links.english: "Looks don't matter, it's what's on the inside that does."
links.polish: „Wygląd nie jest istotny. Najważniejsze jest to, co w środku”.
links.belarusian: "Знешні выгляд не мае значэння. Найважнейшае — гэта тое, што ўнутры".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Yeah, I know -- that's what I'm go..."
links.english: "Yeah, I know -- that's what I'm going by here."
links.polish: „Taa, wiem – właśnie to miałem na myśli”.
links.belarusian: "Так, ведаю — менавіта гэта я меў на ўвазе".

links.title: You: ""I'm never going to get this case s..."
links.english: "I'm never going to get this case solved."
links.polish: „W życiu nie uda mi się rozwiązać tej sprawy”.
links.belarusian: "У жыцці мне не атрымаецца вырашыць гэтую справу".

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""You're not. I really don't believe..."
links.english: "You're not. I really don't believe you are."
links.polish: „Nie rozwiążesz. Naprawdę w to wierzę”.
links.belarusian: "Ты не вырашыш. Я сапраўды ў гэта веру."

links.title: You: "Say nothing. Just flex."
links.english: Say nothing. Just flex.
links.polish: Nic nie mów. Napnij tylko mięśnie.
links.belarusian: Нічога не кажы. Проста напруж мышцы.

links.title: Man with Sunglasses: ""Oh god... it's the fucking muscle..."
links.english: "Oh god... it's the fucking muscle thing..."
links.polish: „O boże... Znowu mu odpierdala z tymi mięśniami...”
links.belarusian: "О Божа... Зноў у яго з гэтымі цягліцамі..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "He is secretly admiring your sea of..."
links.english: He is secretly admiring your sea of muscles. Everyone is.
links.polish: Potajemnie podziwia twoje ogromne muskuły. Jak wszyscy.
links.belarusian: Ціхамірна захапляецца тваімі вялікімі мускуламі. Як усе.
